XI.i.2.B.1.a
.
Circumstances Under Which It Is Necessary to Undertake Development
Undertake development to establish the fact of death, in accordance with
38 CFR 3.211(f)
, by the best obtainable evidence, when
the death of a person cannot be established by any of the types of evidence outlined in
38 CFR 3.211(a)-(e)
, and
the evidence of record indicates death occurred under circumstances that preclude recovery or identification of the body.
Important
:  For the purposes of this block, the term medical officer in
38 CFR 3.211(b)
means a physician, nurse practitioner, or physician assistant with professional qualifications, expertise, and abilities who has been appointed by a company or a civilian or military authority to attend matters relating to health.
